data.title: Frank Miller Comics Reading List!
data.meta_description: Frank Miller is one of the biggest names in comics, as a writer/artist known for transforming the medium with work on superheroes like Daredevil and Batman. In addition to his comics work, Miller is famous for comics such as Sin City and 300, both of which were adapted as popular movies in the 2000’s. Despite Miller’s less-than-respectable critical […]
data.text:
Frank Miller is one of the biggest names in comics, as a writer/artist known for transforming the medium with work on superheroes like Daredevil and Batman. In addition to his comics work, Miller is famous for comics such as Sin City and 300, both of which were adapted as popular movies in the 2000’s.

Despite Miller’s less-than-respectable critical reception throughout the 2000’s, the author of The Dark Knight Returns and Daredevil: Born Again is still frequently considered one of the greatest comic book creators the medium has known.

Below you’ll find a complete guide to Miller’s collected comics works to date.

Related Reading Orders:

Batman

Best comics writers of all time

Frank Miller Comic Books & Graphic Novels

Frank Miller’s Marvel Comics

Daredevil by Frank Miller & Klaus Jason Omnibus

Collects: Daredevil 158-161, 163-191; What If? 28

Daredevil: Born Again

Collects: Daredevil #226-233

Daredevil by Frank Miller Omnibus Companion

Collects: Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spiderman 27-28; Daredevil 219, 226-233; Daredevil: The Man Without Fear 1-5; Marvel Graphic Novel 24 – Daredevil: Love And War

I’d note that this second Frank Miller / Daredevil omnibus overlaps the collection of Born Again listed above.

Marvel Universe by Frank Miller Omnibus

Collects: Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #27-28;Marvel Two-In-One (1974) #51; Marvel Spotlight (1979) #8; Amazing Spider-Man Annual #14-15; Marvel Team-Up Annual #4; Wolverine (1982)#1-4; Marvel Fanfare (1982) #18 — And Material From Marvel Preview #23; Marvel Team-Up (1972) #100; Power Man And Iron Fist (1978) #76; Incredible Hulk Annual #11; And Official Handbook Of The Marvel Universe (1983) #2-6, #8 And #10

Elektra by Frank Miller Omnibus

Collects: Elektra: Assassin 1-8, Elektra Lives Again, Bizarre Adventures 28, What If? 35

Frank Miller’s DC Batman Graphic Novels

Batman Year One

Collects: Batman #404 To #407

1986’s “Year One,” launching out of DC’s Crisis on Infinite Earths with career defining work by Frank Miller and David Mazzucchelli

All-Star Batman & Robin, The Boy Wonder

Collects: All-Star Batman & Robin, The Boy Wonder #1-9

Comics have rarely seen such a discrepancy between expectations and reality, as Frank Miller and Jim Lee teamed up to deliver what still seems like a comic that should have been an all-timer. Instead, it’s an all time laughing stock (cue up the “I’m the goddamned Batman” memes”).

Spawn: Batman

Collects:

1994 crossover between Frank Miller and Todd McFarlane.

Batman: The Dark Knight Returns

Collects: Batman: The Dark Knight Returns #1 To #4

The Dark Knight Returns: The Last Crusade

Collects: Dark Knight Returns: The Last Crusade #1

Frank Miller teams up with John Romita Jr and co-writer Brian Azarello with this prequel story. Chronologically, the story is clearly set before The Dark Knight Returns, but I’d strongly advise against reading it before the all-time great.

Batman: The Dark Knight Strikes Again

Collects: Batman: The Dark Knight Strikes Again #1 To #3

Batman: The Dark Knight: Master Race

Collects: Batman The Dark Knight: Master Race #1 To #9

Frank Miller’s Solo Comics – Sin City, 300, And More!

The Comics Journal Library: Frank Miller : The Interviews : 1981-2003

Eisner/Miller

Collects: An interview transcription on the medium of comics

Frank Miller’s Ronin

Collects: Graphic novel

The Life and Times of Martha Washington in the Twenty-first Century

Collects: Graphic novel

The Hard Goodbye (Sin City)

Sin City Volume 2: A Dame to Kill For

Sin City, Vol. 3: The Big Fat Kill

Sin City Volume 4: That Yellow Bastard

Sin City Volume 5: Family Values

Sin City Volume 6: Booze, Broads, & Bullets

Sin City Volume 7: Hell and Back

Collects: The complete Sin City graphic novel collection

Frank Miller Robocop

Collects: Frank Miller’s uncut adapted scripts for Robocop 2 and Robocop 3

Terminator vs Robocop

Collects: 4 issue crossover series

Frank Miller and Walt Simonson collaborating! Nuff’ said!

300

Collects: Graphic novel

Xerxes: The Fall of the House of Darius and the Rise of Alexander

Collects: Graphic novel

Hard Boiled

Collects: Graphic novel

Holy Terror
